data.title: More effort pledged to protect Buddhism
data.description: The government has vowed to work more actively to protect  Buddhism  by watching out for problems, instead of waiting until they make headlines or people complain about them.

data.title: NT Highlights Role as ASEAN Digital Hub at TELECOMS WORLD ASIA 2024
data.description: National Telecom Public Company Limited (NT) participated in TELECOMS WORLD ASIA 2024, reaffirming its position as a leading telecommunications provider in Thailand and the ASEAN Digital Hub. With robust telecommunications infrastructure and stable international network connections, NT demonstrated its readiness to support the region’s digital economy. The convention took place from 19–20 November 2024 at the Convention Centre, 22nd floor, Centara Grand Hotel at CentralWorld, Bangkok.

data.title: How Thai Airways plans to expand and reclaim market dominance
data.description: CEO unveils ambitious strategy to take 35% market share by 2029

data.title: Buri Ram land dispute ‘affects hundreds’
data.description: More than 900 long-time local residents stand to be affected by a court ruling in the  Khao Kradong  land controversy in  Buri Ram , according to Deputy Interior Minister Songsak Thongsri.

data.title: THAI to offer shares at 4.48 baht in debt-to-equity conversion
data.description: Thai Airways’ plan to offer over 9 billion ordinary shares to eligible shareholders from December 6 to 12 has been met with strong creditor interest

data.title: Paetongtarn hosts 40 US firms, promises support for investments
data.description: The meeting centred on strengthening bilateral economic ties, with a special focus on clean energy, digital tech and the film industry

data.title: Three flyovers to be axed for Orange Line
data.description: The Mass Rapid Transit Authority of Thailand (MRTA) has unveiled plans to dismantle three key  flyovers  in Bangkok to enable construction of the  Orange Line  electric railway, along with measures to minimise the impact on  traffic .

data.title: SRT suspends services to the deep South as railway tracks flooded
data.description: The State Railway of Thailand (SRT) adjusted its itinerary on the Southern Line on Wednesday due to severe flooding.

data.title: LiteFinance Joins Leicester City as Official Partner
data.description: We are excited to announce  that LiteFinance  has entered into a multi-year partnership with Premier League football club Leicester City as their Official Trading Partner. This collaboration marks a significant milestone for LiteFinance as we expand our presence in the world of sports, aligning our brand with one of England’s most admired football clubs.

data.title: Unlocking the Secrets of Internet Security for Everyday Users
data.description: Our reliance on the Internet for communication, work, entertainment, and shopping is undeniable. However, this convenience brings with it significant security risks. For everyday users, understanding how to protect their online presence is more important than ever. In this guide, we will unlock the secrets of internet security and provide you with essential tips and tools to stay safe online.

data.title: Kanchanaburi seeks reopening of border pass
data.description: Officials in  Kanchanaburi  province hope the Ban Phu Nam Ron  border pass  can be reopened by the New Year to boost cross-border trade, employment and investment between Thailand and Myanmar.

data.title: Floods inundate over a 100 households in Songkhla and Yala provinces
data.description: Locals in Songkhla and Yala provinces were forced to evacuate to higher ground following floods caused by heavy rains early on Wednesday.

data.title: Double A Reports 22.5% Increase in Profit for the First 9 Months of 2024
data.description: Double A (1991) Public Company Limited has announced its Q3/2024 financial performance, recording total revenue of 5.872 billion baht and a net profit of 645 million baht. For the first nine months of the year, the company achieved a net profit of 1.809 billion baht, representing a 22.5% increase compared to the same period last year, which recorded a net profit of 1.477 billion baht. This success is attributed to effective cost management, efficient foreign exchange handling, and market expansion into new countries, including India and Australia, driving continuous sales and profit growth.

data.title: Phumtham says he’s yet to study report on stalled submarine project
data.description: Defence minister denies dragging his feet on prickly issue

data.title: Thai maid’s 100 million baht inheritance comes under legal scrutiny
data.description: Though many believe Auntie Tim may lose her windfall, a senior public prosecutor says the French woman’s questionable business practices and her will are unrelated

data.title: Lese-majeste prisoner wins early release
data.description: A Phitsanulok woman jailed for  lese-majeste  was released from prison on Wednesday, a month before her 18-month sentence was to end, after a court approved her request to withdraw her appeal, according to Thai Lawyers for Human Rights (TLHR).

data.title: Hylife Group Unveils Sustainable 400-Million-Baht Food Facility
data.description: Hylife Group has launched its  Hylife Global Foods  facility, a state-of-the-art 400-million-baht investment poised to revolutionise the food processing industry. Scheduled to open on  10 December 2024  in Chiang Mai, the facility integrates advanced technologies to promote environmental sustainability, align with global standards, and foster long-term growth while benefiting local communities.

data.title: Thailand expects sweet economic boost from its cocoa ambitions
data.description: The country aims to become a cocoa hub in the region by boosting local industry, promoting high-quality products and branding them as GI items

data.title: International arrest warrant sought for Myanmar junta chief
data.description: THE HAGUE, Netherlands - The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court (ICC) said on Wednesday he would seek an arrest warrant for Myanmar’s military leader  Min Aung Hlaing  for crimes against humanity over the persecution of Muslim  Rohingya  people.

data.title: Record November snowfall hits Seoul
data.description: SEOUL - South Korea’s capital was blanketed on Wednesday by the heaviest November snowfall on record, with bad weather snarling traffic, knocking out power and grounding hundreds of flights as authorities braced for more snow in coming days.

data.title: Inside the Pheu Thai PR machine fighting Thailand’s information war
data.description: Key figures ramp up efforts to shape the party's image, counter criticism, and rally support amid growing challenges to the government

data.title: New feasts for your palate
data.description: Bangkok is a city that never sleeps, at least in the food and beverage department. Blink and you’ll miss another new restaurant opening or a drink launch. Guru By Bangkok Post  is making sure that even if you blink, you don’t miss out on the new taste tinglers that are worth mentioning.

data.title: DSI, SEC urged to probe Thai Oil’s tanked THB160-bn clean fuel project
data.description: Chief of consumer network warns listed company risks bankruptcy because of the actions of some execs

data.title: Bangkok’s historic Chakrabongse Villas open to visitors for two days
data.description: The 116 years old Chakrabongse Villas in Bangkok’s Phra Nakhon district will be opened to visitors as a part of the 6th Antiques & Culture Fair from November 30 to December 1.

data.title: Thailand’s electricity price set to drop slightly in 2025
data.description: Energy minister says the cut is part of the government’s New Year’s gifts for the public, adding more price reductions are being explored

data.title: 3 arrested, 101 million baht in assets seized in ONCB crackdown
data.description: This operation in five provinces, including Bangkok, follows up on a previous successful crackdown that provided intelligence on bigger players

data.title: Thai zoos to expand ‘Moo’ population
data.description: Plans are under way for the older brother of the celebrity hippo Moo Deng  to mate with Moo Manao of the Nakhon Ratchasima Zoo to expand the pygmy hippopotamus population in Thailand.

data.title: Philippine police file complaint against VP Duterte
data.description: MANILA - Philippine Police have filed a formal complaint against Vice President Sara Duterte and several of her security detail over a recent incident at the lower house of Congress.

data.title: Mae Hong Son expects to welcome 1.2 million tourists by year-end
data.description: Full bloom Mexican sunflowers will be a major attraction

data.title: A roaring return
data.description: The return of American pop-rock band Imagine Dragons on Saturday was worth the six-year wait.

data.title: AOT to pay for Suvarnabhumi noise pollution next year
data.description: The airports authority earmarks 12 billion baht to cover compensations for noise pollution caused by the third runway

data.title: Malaysia drops 1MDB-linked charges against ex-PM Najib
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR - A Malaysian court on Wednesday allowed corruption charges linked to the multibillion-dollar 1MDB scandal filed against jailed former prime minister Najib Razak and the former treasury chief to be dropped, their lawyers said.

data.title: Beyond Koh Lipe: Explore Satun’s pristine Koh Bulon islands
data.description: Escape the crowds and discover the South’s hidden gem with one-day trips to the serene islands, that offer crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral reefs and tranquil beaches

data.title: Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok Unveils “Infinitude” Christmas Tree
data.description: Kimpton Maa-Lai Bangkok has partnered with the sustainable Thai fashion brand PIPATCHARA to create the Infinitude Christmas Tree, an ethereal four-metre-tall installation made from upcycled plastics, on display in the hotel lobby from 25 November 2024 to 5 January 2025.

data.title: Beyond Koh Lipe: Explore Satun’s pristine Koh Bulon islands
data.description: Escape the crowds and discover the South’s hidden gem with one-day trips to the serene islands, that offer crystal-clear waters, vibrant coral reefs and tranquil beaches

data.title: Transport Ministry heads to court in Khao Kradong land battle
data.description: Legal team to produce 10 documents ‘proving’ Buri Ram plots belong to State Railway, says minister Suriya

data.title: ICONSIAM Shines as a World-Class Thai Landmark
data.description: ICONSIAM, the iconic global destination on Bangkok

data.title: Thai, 5 Chinese arrested after sneaking across Myanmar border into Tak
data.description: A Thai man was arrested after helping five Chinese nationals  illegally enter Thailand from Myanmar  in the northern province of Tak on Tuesday evening.

data.title: Manhunt underway as 3 shot dead in northeastern Thailand
data.description: NONG BUA LAMPHU: A man, 57, shot dead three people in Sri Bun Ruang district of this northeastern province on Wednesday morning.
